message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper discusses the use of recurrent neural networks for solving partially observed control problems in reinforcement learning. This involves training the networks with backpropagation through time to handle memory requirements. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.RO (Robotics). The use of neural networks also suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses learning directly from pixels, which suggests cs.CV (Computer Vision) as a possible sub-category.
